VLIB Function Reference

Histogram Equalization

Introduction and Use Cases

Histogram equalization is used to redistribute the intensity values of an image to span the full dynamic range (0-255 for 8-bit pixels). This has the visual effect of increasing the contrast of the image.

Specification

Variants

This functionality is available in 2 variants:
  • Fixed point integer math (UQ24.8) : VLIB_histogram_equal_8
  • Single precision floating point math (VLIB_F32) : VLIB_histogram_equal_8_f32
    • Not available in the C64P or C674 libraries

Inputs


    Parameter       Description                                        Both Variants
    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    image[]         8-bit input image array                                (UQ8.0)
    n               Number of pixels in the input image                    (SQ31.0)
    t_hist[]        Array of scratch buffer to calculate the histogram     (SQ15.0)
    histeq_image[]  8-bit output image array                               (UQ8.0)

Method

This function first calculates the histogram and the cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the image for n pixels. The CDF is then used to transform each pixel in the image array into the histeq_image, such that the new CDF becomes linear.

APIS

  • VLIB_histogram_equal_8
  • VLIB_histogram_equal_8_f32
